0.name: Introduction to Pension Mathematics
0.description: Learn about how actuarial functions apply to pension plan funding. Seminar covers topics of liability, accrued benefic, and projected benefit cost methods.

1.description: This seminar focuses on basic communications skills that are vital in the area of personal and commercial banking. Skills learned in this seminar are applicable to all fields, so everyone is invited to attend.

0.name: Workshop: Life Insurance Practice
0.description: Learn about the pricing, risk management, and mortality and maturity guarantees in insurance products.

1.description: Some say that compound interest is one of the wonders of the world. This seminar will cover how to compute the amount that a loan will cost after its interest is taken into account. Basic math skills recommended.

0.name: Direct Memory Access Seminar

1.description: A beginner's seminar for those outside of this field but are interested in learning more. No experience required!

0.name: Introduction to RSA Workshop
0.description: RSA is a modern technique used by computers to encrypt and decrypt messages. The algorithm was described in 1978 by Ron Rivest, Adi Shamir, and Leonard Adleman and involves taking the product of prime numbers to produce a public key that can only be decrypted if the prime factors are known. This seminar is good for both computer scientists in the security and cryptography field and those who are interested in learning more about online security.

1.name: Basic Password Hashing and Authentication
1.description: This seminar is an introduction to one of the methods used to keep passwords secure. Hashing involves taking data of any length and turning it into data of fixed length. We will discuss the hashing algorithm and the benefits of using password hashing as a security method.

0.question: How to hash
0.description: I am interested in incorporating password hashing as an added level of security. Is there anyone available to meet up and discuss this?

1.question: Reverse Hash?
1.description: Why is it that hashes cannot be reversed?

0.name: History of Operating Systems
